name.ch: 信號完整度與電磁相容

goal.en: Signal integrity refers to the analysis and design of "chip-to-chip interconnect". An interconnect consists of driver, channel, and receiver. In particular, the "channel" includes packaging, printed circuit board (PCB), connectors and cables. The governing physical law in the channel part is Maxwell's equations, while transmission lines and S parameters are the essential tools to describe the channel. The primary job of an SI engineer is to ensure the signal going out of the driver can reach the receiver with acceptable quality. To that end, an SI engineer should be equipped with the following knowledge: (1) Driver circuit, (2) Transmission line theory, (3) Receiver circuit, (4) Analysis techniques. In this course, we will study (2) and (4) in detail, while (1) and (3) will also be discussed briefly. This course will have >20 small homework. Students are not required to do all these homework to get an A in the final grade. However, if all homework are thoroughly completed, you will have a comprehensive understanding of SI, and will acquire the basic skills for being an SI engineer.

grading.en: Homework 100%, which includes: (1) ~24 homework, each accounts for 7% of final grade. (2) homework presentation: each week we will randomly select a few students to briefly describe their homework report in class. The report of the selected students will be displayed to the whole class, and I will ask some questions for the presenters regarding their results. If the selected students are absent, they will get 0 score for that homework. Also note that the reports of all students of all homework will be open for every one in class to view, in the eeclass system.
